txt.en: In the southern reaches of the Ashenslades, Ânghum-maudhûl stands as the central rallying point for Orcs in the area.

'In the southern reaches of the Ashenslades, the Orcs have built a large defensible position surrounding a set of ancient ruins. These ruins are called Ânghum-maudhûl by the Enemy.

'Would you travel to Ânghum-maudhûl and scout the area? There are three specific areas that I wish you to patrol for me: the western and eastern approaches to the camp and a small camp directly across from the main rallying point.

'Ânghum-maudhûl lies south-east of here, along the southern border of the Ashenslades.'

Ânghum-maudhûl lies to the south-east of Mithechad.\n\nHarchador has asked you to explore the western and eastern approaches to the camp and a small camp directly across from the main rallying point at Ânghum-maudhûl.
'Thank you for scouting this dangerous place...perhaps it would be a good target for a distraction, so that our incursions to the north might go well.'
Harchador is at Mithechad, north-west of Ânghum-maudhûl.\n\nYou should return to Harchador and give your report on Ânghum-maudhûl.
'Please travel to Ânghum-maudhûl, south-east of here, and scout out the forces arrayed against us.'
